title: [Large-scale] Reggio Emilia Approach-Based Instructional Design for Promoting Physical Activity in Early Childhood Distance Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational early childhood education theories and basic understanding of the Reggio Emilia approach
context.additional_context: Development of practical instructional design strategies for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to apply in early childhood education settings

learning_goals: Learners can design strategies to promote young children's physical activities in limited environments using principles of the Reggio Emilia Approach
Learners can apply methods for observing and documenting young children's physical activities in smartphone-based remote education settings through project-based assessments
Learners can propose creative learning environment designs considering physical constraints within home settings

resources: Scientific Materials on Early Childhood Physical Development
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
